channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Sorcerer (neutral wildcard)
channel.description:
**Passive: Magic surge** You have 2 charges. You lose 1 every night you don't kill. You gain 1 every time you kill someone. If you ever have 0 charges, you will explode in a rush of pent-up magic, causing you to die.
**Passive: Meditate** You do not lose charges on night you are occupied
**Night ability: Flaming bolt** _Infinite uses_ Kill the target.
**Night ability: Chain lightning** _infinite uses, 2-day cool down_ Kill the target, whoever they visit, and whoever that person visits.
**Day ability: Arcane ward** _expends a charge_ You will be immune to visits the follow night.
goal: survive

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Sorcerer (neutral wildcard)
item.dc:creator: Ashe
item.description:
Yeah, this class would be frustrating to play as, or with. There’s no reason why it wouldn’t have standard NK goal, or why it can’t just be a killer. In saying that, if it did have a standard NK goal, there’s no reason for its passive to even exist, since you would be killing to reach your goal. Also, Wildcard is reserved for classes that don’t fit in anywhere else. This is not that. Refer to the two existing wildcards, the Fool and the Scorned. Both have unique win conditions (read: not just surviving) and abilities the specifically cater to reaching their goal. This is just a neutral killer with a goal that doesn’t match. I will also say how ridiculously powerful Chain Lightning could be, even with a 2 day cooldown, but, since this class doesn’t have death immunity, you would almost always kill yourself with it. This class is all over the place.
